History

Zipleze bought some steel and an unfinished returning shield from Dunar, the shopkeeper and owner of Heart of Ironforge. The party then proceeded to offload a bunch of old swords and weaponry to him.

Highlights

  • Freya asked Zipleze for a dagger for undisclosed reasons, before selling it immediately to Dunar for a measly 5 gold.

Electric Emporiums

History

Lothar, a halfling male, sold the party some magical items before the King's Ball in Drovic. These included the Lantern of Revealing for Hayn, Nolzur's Marvelous Pigments for Tarin, and a Ring of Protection for Freya.

Highlights

  • Hayn managed to get a discount after persuading Lothar to give him one "for a brother (halfling)". Also acquired a free forgery kit from him.
  • Freya managed to trick her way into paying half price for the Ring of Protection with a sob story.

  • A fragment of Godsbane - the blade - was found in the lost city of Mem Nonnar attached to a colossal sized lava creature, whom the party speculate caused the destruction of Mem Nonnar after gaining powers from the fragment of Godsbane.
  • Freed a unicorn from Idrisir's tower, with the unicorn eventually watching of Boab as it's protector.
  • Killed Idrisir in his tower before leaving to the Material Plane.

Cape Renozo is a city located on the south-west shores of Franzictini. It is theocratically ruled by the leader of the Paladin Order.

History

Highlights

  • Party cured Morvello of his lycanthropic affliction.
  • Killed the Serpent of Aldas Island near the harbors.

entry.title: Velania Firanova
entry.content:
[!infobox|right ]

Velania Firanova

Physical Information
Attribute
Age Young Adult
Gender Female
Race Half-Elf
Condition Alive
Basic Information
Attribute
Level 12
Class(es) Druid,Cleric
Standing Friendly
Location Party
Player Nathan
Relationships
Name Relationship
Khiramine Firanova Brother

Velania Firanova

History

Velania - alongside her brother Khiramine - grew up in the city of Menta, bordering the northern-most Great Forest. Their father belonged to The Council - the local government responsible for the safety of it's people and keeper's of information. She stumbled across the party, not yet known as Bad Company, after Khiramine had been transported away during the parties fight with Giorno.

Sometime later, during a trip to Menta, the party was banished from returning and subsequently pursued by Menta troops.

Highlights

entry.title: Tarin Bolirahn
entry.content:
[!infobox|right ]

Tarin Bolirahn

Physical Information
Attribute
Age Young Adult
Gender Male
Race Elf
Condition Alive
Basic Information
Attribute
Level 12
Class(es) Sorcerer
Standing Friendly
Location Party
Player Jonathon
Relationships
Name Relationship
Atlas Wife

Tarin Bolirahn

History

Tarin Bolirahn met with Armmyr Dopplet on the road to Vindor, in search of answers about the disappearance of his hometown - Boab - as-well as a search for his partner Atlas. Alongside Armmyr, he and a few others would form an adventuring party - that would later be known as Bad Company - to help with a plague effecting Vindor. He formed an adversarial relationship with Leo Denteli, whom was the cause of Boab's disappearance, before making peace with him after the revelation of his enthrallment.

Highlights

entry.title: Kril
entry.content:
[!infobox|right ]

Kril

Physical Information
Attribute
Age Adult
Gender Male
Race Firbolg
Condition Alive
Basic Information
Attribute
Level 12
Class(es) Fighter
Standing Friendly
Location Mount Franz
Player Brophey
Relationships
Name Relationship
- -

Kril

History

Little is known on Kril, except that he eventually found shelter inside the vast tunnel system in Mount Franz. The party, Bad Company, would eventually stumble upon him on their trek up the mountain in search of Bento and Leo Denteli. Having been injured by Leo on their way up the mountain, he agreed to help the party up the mountain, and escorted them through the tunnels and to the peak. There, they fought Bento and Leo, whereupon he left the party, closing a portal to the Elemental Plane of Fire as the rest of them went inside in search of the sword Dawnbringer and a fragment of Godsbane.

Highlights

  • Ripped Orcus's horn from Leo's head, freeing him of his enthrallment.
  • Stayed behind to close the portal into the Elemental Plane of Fire.

entry.title: Hayn Underfoot
entry.content:
[!infobox|right ]

Hayn Underfoot

Physical Information
Attribute
Age Young Adult
Gender Male
Race Halfling
Condition Alive
Basic Information
Attribute
Level 12
Class(es) Rogue,Warlock
Standing Friendly
Location Party
Player Steven
Relationships
Name Relationship
Eran Underfoot Brother

Hayn Underfoot

History

Hayn was born alongside twin Eran in the town of Vindor. Despite similar environments, Eran would grow up to become a well respected, small time merchant in Vindor. Dissimilarly, Hayn grew up a peddler of illegal goods, a pickpocket, and a thief. Eventually, at behest of a lord of Vindor, he alongside a few others formed a party to attend to an issue effecting the region. Eventually, this party would form into the adventuring party Bad Company.

Highlights

  • The God of Thieves, Mask, provided a job to retrieve an artifact called The Globe.
  • Hayn was chosen by the Matron of Ravens, providing him a touch of magic.

entry.title: Freya Lorhalien
entry.content:
[!infobox|right ]

Freya Lorhalien

Physical Information
Attribute
Age Teenager
Gender Female
Race Eladrin
Condition Alive
Basic Information
Attribute
Level 12
Class(es) Bard,Warlock
Standing Friendly
Location Party
Player Don
Relationships
Name Relationship
- -

Freya Lorhalien

History

Bad Company first stumbled across Freya at The Spire, located in the north-east of Franzictini. Cowering after being shunted through a portal by her parents, the party brought her along with them - hoping to get her back to the Fey and back home. Eventually the party would have to travel through the Fey, where they found her village burnt to the ground. After an encounter with (forgot), she gained the ability from a powerful Ent, which allows her to plant seeds in various dimensions; These seeds would allow for travel between the dimensions.

The party eventually split when half jumped into the portal on top of Mount Franz, which led to the Elemental Plane of Fire. She would remain with Zipleze Rimmore in Irridanel, where the two would disagree on the feasibility of Inchcomb's idea of transferring his mind to a robotic body. After Inchcomb turned evil and effectively destroyed Irridanel - in the process slaughtering many innocents - Freya would loathe Zipleze for what he helped cause.

Highlights

  • Killed by a bugbear during a fight in the underdark under Covin, and subsequently resurrected by Barnar.

entry.title: Arthur Maynard
entry.content:
[!infobox|right ]

Arthur Maynard

Physical Information
Attribute
Age Young Adult
Gender Male
Race Human
Condition Alive
Basic Information
Attribute
Level 12
Class(es) Paladin
Standing Friendly
Location Party
Player Nick
Relationships
Name Relationship
Morvello Adopted Father
Abigail Maynard Birth Mother

Arthur Maynard

History

Arthur was born to Abigail Maynard. During an attack, his future adopted father Morvello found them. After her death, Morvello took Arthur under the tutelage of himself and the Paladin Order of Cape Renozo. Taking on an Oath of Devotion under the god Heironeous, he would eventually make his way to Vindor and join up with a group of adventurers, later becoming known as Bad Company. He was killed in a fight against Inchcomb before being brought back to life via Barnar Dankil's revivify spell, but in the process lost an eye and had the side of his face scarred.

Highlights

  • Fought his mother, whom turned into a giant snake due to a curse, during her attack on Cape Renozo. Subsequently ended Morvello's curse that was cast on him from his mother.
  • Abandoned his oath under Heironeous, finding new purpose with an Oath of Redemption under the god Sarenrae.
  • Lost an eye in the fight against Inchcomb.

Gilmore

History

Gilmore is an eccentric shopkeeper who specializes in the trade of magical items. He has helped Bad Company numerous times, once hiding the group in his basement at his shop after a run-in with the law.

Highlights

Faith Alchey

History

Faith Alcy runs the alchemical shop Alcy's Alchemicals, located in the city of Drovic. The party encountered her on their trip to attend the King's Ball. She sold the party a few potions, namely a couple potions of animal speaking, greater healing potions, and speed potions. Before the party left, she mentioned to Arthur that Fish Folk took over the docks, where she would normally obtain clam tongue - an ingredient needed for a potion of giant size.

Highlights

Craig

History

Craig is a traveling merchant that Bad Company occasionally stumble into.

Stumbled across Craig again outside Covin on the parties way to Drovic. He sold the party many goods, including a sword for Hayn, shield for Arthur, goggles for Zipleze, cloak for Armmyr, armour of weightlessness for Freya, a puzzler's ring for Tarin, and some extra potions for the party.

Highlights

The party first encountered King Drovic IV during the King's Ball, after being invited by Lord Redowith.

Ashai

History

Lady Gwena was the right hand and court mage of King Drovic IV, King of Drovic. During the King's Ball in Drovic, the party noticed a coloration of her eyes and face, and she teleported away during a sudden fight from the cult.

The party later encountered her again in the sewer, as her real form - Ashai, daughter of the Twilight Phoenix. The party defeated her in their fight in the sewers.

Highlights

| Arthur Maynard | Adopted Son |

Morvello

History

Morvello was first encountered during the parties journey to Cape Renozo. It would eventually be known that he had contracted lycanthropy, and had been leaving the city during full moons to avoid killing innocents.

Highlights

entry.title: Miscellaneous Characters
entry.content:
Relationships

  • Eran Underfoot, brother of Hayn Underfoot - Killed by Kent prior to the start of the campaign.

Enemies

  • Idrisir, a grand wizard who resided in a tower in the city of Brass. Kept a Unicorn captive, which the party freed. The party broke into his tower, ultimately killing him on their way back out of the Elemental Plane of Fire.

  • Kan Regz, a hobgoblin serving Bane, God of Tyranny. Killed by the party in the underdark under Covin. Given reward by Lord Redowith.

Shopkeeper's

  • Antony Castillo, hispanic-looking "shopkeeper" who pretended to have useful goods outside Drovic. Caused a fight with some off-duty guards, including Gert, whom he sold a fake boner potion.

  • Andor Castillo, hispanic-looking Antony's brother. Bard of King Drovic IV. Met during the King's Ball, and subsequently rescued after he had been taken.

Guards

  • Gert, guard who attacked the party outside of Drovic.

Political

  • Lord Redowith, a lord of Covin. Rewarded the party with invitations to the King's Ball in Drovic after they defeated Kan Regz, a local hobgoblin leader..

Other

  • Remirez Castillo, hispanic-looking, father of both Antony and Andor; part of the crew that created the Manawar Armada, the large airship that patrols around Drovic. Worked alongside it's inventor, Hominom^Remirez
  • Hominom Dryadalis, inventor of the Manawar Armada, worked alongside Remirez. Banished from Drovic after refusing to cease experiments. Kept a journal, titled: "Divinity - The Original Sin".
  • A unicorn, freed by the party on their way out of the city of Brass. Held captive by a wizard, Idrisir. Afterwards, this unicorn decided to reside in the Great Forests surrounding Boab, acting as it's protector.

entry.title: Leo Denteli
entry.content:
[!infobox|right ]

Leo Denteli

Physical Information

| |
---|---|
| Age | Adult |
| Gender | Male |
| Race | Half-Elf |
| Condition | Alive |

Basic Information

||
---|---|
| Level | 7 |
| Class(es) | Monk |
| Standing | Friendly |
| Location | Boab |

Relationships

| |
---| ---|
| - | - |

Leo Denteli

History

Little is known of Leo's prior life before encountering Bad Company. It is known that Leo went into service with Orcus after being promised his wife - whom had previously died. After being defeated by Bad Company, Orcus resurrected him by implanting a horn in his head; this horn would later removed by Kril during the parties fight with Bento. Here, he joined the party to help with the search of Dawnbringer and the fragment of Godsbane.

Highlights

  • Caused the disappearance of the village of Boab, home of Tarin Bolirahn and partner Atlas.
  • Horn of Orcus pulled from his head by Kril during Bad Company's fight with Bento.

entry.title: Korbin Dopplet
entry.content:
[!infobox|right ]

Korbin Dopplet

Physical Information

| |
---|---|

| Race | Human |
| Condition | Alive |

| Class(es) | Fighter |
| Standing | Friendly |
| Location | Irridanel |

Relationships

| |
---| ---|
| Armmyr Dopplet | Brother |

Korbin Dopplet

History

Korbin is the brother of Armmyr Dopplet. At some point, Korbin managed to get bit by a werewolf - contracting lycanthropy. The party managed to cure him of his affliction. The party met up with Korbin again at Irridanel, during the crisis at Mount Franz and subsequent battle with Inchcomb. Korbin is now an impromptu leader of Irridanel.

Highlights

entry.title: Irygl
entry.content:
[!infobox|right ]

Irygl

Relationships

| |
---| ---|
| - | - |

Irygl

History

The party first encountered Irygl when searching for her in search of a cure for the plague surrounding Vindor. Eventually they learn that the pestilence was caused by Orcus, and to defeat him they must rebuild the weapon known as Godsbane. She would help the party on their journey, until eventually settling in the small forest village of Boab.

Highlights

entry.title: Raven Queen
entry.content:
[!infobox|right ]

Raven Queen

Physical Information

| |
---|---|
| Age | Ancient |
| Gender | Female |
| Race | Human |
| Condition | Alive |

| Class(es) | =this.class |
| Standing | Neutral |
| Location | Unknown |

Relationships

| |
---| ---|
| - | - |

Raven Queen

History

Hayn was granted powers by the Raven Queen in exchange for him returning souls to her. During the parties trip to Drovic for the King's Ball, Hayn was instructed to go to the top of the largest archer tower and release 3 souls he had collected to her. In exchange, he was granted the ability to summon a reaper once a day.

Highlights

  • Granted Hayn a boon, allowing him to summon a reaper once a day.

entry.title: Mask
entry.content:
[!infobox|right ]

Mask

Relationships

| |
---| ---|

Mask

History

Mask appeared before Hayn as a small halfling man during their visit to Anaheim, after knowledge of his brother Eran's appearance in the city. Mask had enlisted the party to break into a vault, belonging to Vidorant, and retrieve a relic known as The World - a palm sized globe with the ability to temporarily control the flow of time. After successfully stealing the globe, the party attempted to sneak out of the city when he reappeared to the party. He said that he would allow the party to keep it, but that they must not allow it to get into the hands of Cyric.

Highlights

Cyric

History

The God Cyric, once a human man, is the current patron of Armmyr Dopplet. He has a hostile relationship with the God Mask, whom he had used in the form of a weapon known as Godsbane.

Highlights

Artagan

History

Artagan was the patron of Tarin Bolirahn. After Tarin refused to give up the fragment of Godsbane to him, Artagan severed their pact.

Highlights

Epiphren Ramsey

History

The party first met Epiphren in Vindor, where the majority of the party first came together. There, he helped the party until a large force of Orc's began pillaging from the Wild Lands, to the north; Here, he split from the party, his fate unknown until they met with him again.

Epiphren now primarily stays in the small community of Boab, where he assists the community using his unusual strength.

Highlights

[!infobox|right ]

Orcus

History

The Demon Lord Orcus is a demon that threatens Franzictini, and is currently being sought after by Bad Company. Little is known about him, but he once employed the demon Bento, as-well as subjugated the undead monk Leo Denteli. The party seeks the fragments of the legendary god slaying weapon Godsbane, in hope of defeating him.

Highlights

entry.title: Kent
entry.content:
[!infobox|right ]

Kent

Physical Information

| |
---|---|
| Age | Adult |
| Gender | Male |
| Race | Human |
| Condition | Alive |

| Class(es) | Fighter |
| Standing | Hostile |
| Location | Drovic |

Relationships

| |
---| ---|
| - | - |

Kent

History

Kent, the Red Skull Bounty Hunter, was a former associate of Hayn Underfoot. Hayn's brother Eran Underfoot died after Hayn gave Kent information on some valuables in Eran's possession.

He later reappeared in Drovic, appearing as a unknown bounty hunter ambushing Hayn and Arthur Maynard after their search for a hidden smuggled object. During the ensuing fight, Kent took a civilian hostage before falling unconcious from an airborne attack from Hayn. After finding out of Kent's identity, he and Arthur traveled outside of Drovic, planning to interrogate him at their fort just outside the city.

Highlights

  • Killed Hayn Underfoot's Eran.
  • Knocked out in Drovic by Hayn.

Gert

History

The party encountered Gert outside of Drovic, after he and a group of men attempted to kill the "merchant" Antony, whom was attempting to scam the party with bad goods. Gert had bought an "enhancement" potion from him, which did not work in the bedroom. A letter was found on him that mentioned that Asmodeous's (the king of hell and god of indulgence) mount Twilight Phoenix is real.

Gert was last seen running back into Drovic, after his defeat by the party.

Highlights

Bento

History

Bento was a demon commanded by Demon Lord Orcus. He - along with Leo Denteli - attempted to stop Bad Company on their quest to find Godsbane, but was eventually slain on the peak of Mount Franz during their fight to save Irridanel from catastrophe.

Highlights

| |

Elric

History

Bad Company first came across Elric on their way to the city of Brass. Elric was being attacked by creatures while he attempted to retrieve a bag he had hidden in the area. After defeating them, Elric gave the party assistance in entering the city, and getting them to someone who may know information on Dawnbringer, as-well as the piece of Godsbane.

At one point, Elric brought the party back to his home, and they met his mother - whom was suffering from a genetic disease. Arthur proceeded to heal her of her affliction with his Lay on Hands, and they mentioned the possibility of helping Elric escape the Elemental Plane of Fire on their way out.

Highlights
